Both Tutankhamun and Chandragupta Maurya were significant historical figures who held power in their respective regions during ancient times. Tutankhamun was a pharaoh in Egypt, while Chandragupta Maurya was the founder of the Maurya Empire in Pataliputra (modern-day Patna, India). Additionally, both rulers were associated with the end or beginning of important dynasties in their respective regions. Tutankhamun's death marked the end of the Eighteenth Dynasty in Egypt, while Chandragupta Maurya's reign marked the beginning of the powerful Maurya Empire in Pataliputra.
